title: Vessel
text: Besides dogs, Colima artists sculpted in clay other animals found in their West Mexican habitat. This well-fed coati (also coati-mundi or tej√≥n) is a relative of the raccoon. It is shown eating what is possibly an ear of corn, emblematic of coatis association with agricultural fertility.
description: vessel in the form of a coati-mundi seated on its haunches and holding its forepaws to its mouth to nibble something; the back of the head is incised to represent fur; brownish surface much worn
creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
